recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Dum Biryani is a blend of rice and vegetables\meat\egg where rice is cooked separately from the thick curry(meat\vegetables). The curry and rice is then layered and cooked together giving a distinct flavor to rice and the curry.

Originally, the dish is from the kitchen of Mughal Emperors. Over the period of time, the dish has evolved and is now available in many forms like Hyderabadi biryani, Lucknowi biryani, calcutta biryani, bombay biryani, etc.
Veg/Mutton/Egg/Shrimp/Chicken/Fish biryani are most known types.

preface: I have been always a fan of biryani and had been trying different ways to make one until i tasted my friends recipe. It tasted just like an authenticate chicken biryani. Thanks to her for sharing the recipe with me. I did make some changes to it, but the base recipe remains the same. It takes some prep work beforehand that I have mentioned below

ingredientList.measurementQuantity: 1 kg, cut into desired pieces, washed

procedureSteps.stepDescription: In a pan, put oil. Once heated, add onions and little salt. Fry till it turns browns. Add green chillies, fry for 3-4 minutes. Then add ginger garlic paste. Saut√© for 2 mins or till raw smell goes away.

Add chicken pieces, salt and cook uncovered until pink color of chicken is no longer visible. Now add tomato puree and biryani masala, mix it well. Cook covered on medium flame, until chicken is cooked (15 mins approx) . Stir in between to avoid it getting burnt.

Remove the lid and and cook chicken on medium-high heat till oil separates and only 25% moisture is left. Reduce the flame, to medium. Add curd \ yoghurt, mix it well. Cook uncovered for 5 minutes. The final masala should be in semi liquid form. Not too much gravy or too dry. Once done, keep it aside.
Coarsely grinde cloves, peppercorns, cardamon, cinnamon and wrap it in a muslin cloth so that the ingredients don't come out.

Wash rice thoroughly. Keep rice for boiling. Add bay leaves, salt and the muslin cloth. Let it cook until the rice is only 75% cooked. Drain water completely. Add ghee and mix it carefully. Keep it aside.
In a kadai, deep fry the onions. Also, in little ghee, fry cashews and raisins. Keep it aside on a tissue paper to remove excess oil.

In a mortar and pestle, along with a pinch of sugar, crush saffron. Add it to milk, keep it in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight. This will release yellow color and will give give nice color to rice. Sugar helps makes it easier to crush saffron.

Take  a heavy bottom pan, lightly grease it with oil. Put a layer of 1/3 rice. Then put 1/2 chicken masala. On top of that add chopped cilantro and mint leaves, along with cashews, raisins and fried onions.

Again, add a layer of 1/3 rice, remaining chicken, chopped cilantro, mint leaves, cashews, raisins and fried onions. Add remaining rice on top with remaining chopped cilantro, mint leaves, cashews, raisins and fried onions. Now take the saffron milk and pour it all over rice. Cover the pan properly, so that steam do not escape. Cook on a very low heat for 30 mins.
Enjoy hot with salads and raita.

tips.tipDesc: You can add food color if you don't have saffron at home. Also, rice initially should not be cooked completely, otherwise final biryani would be very soggy.
